Description: Bronze lamp with an elongated body and a long splayed and fluked nozzle, angular below, with an angular tip and an almost circular wick-hole. The dished upper surface is damaged and split; a flat rim extends all round the body and nozzle. There is a triple filling-hole. The handle is lost; there is a hole in the rear body and traces of a rectangular spring. The raised circular base is sunk within.
Curator's comments: There are indications that the handle was applied rather than cast with the lamp.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3686)
